summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a massage therapist who worked at Jeffrey Epstein's New Mexico ranch from approximately 2000-2003. The witness describes providing massages to Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and others, details the layout of the ranch, and states the massages with Epstein turned sexual. She also mentions being given a non-disclosure agreement and interactions with Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the investigation. The witness massaged him approximately 15 times at his New Mexico ranch, and the massages turned sexual. He visited the ranch 3-4 times per year.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as the 'lady of the house' and Epstein's girlfriend. She coordinated the witness's visits, gave her a non-disclosure agreement, and was massaged approximately 5 times. She made comments about the appearance of potential new masseuses.

persons.name: Omer
persons.context: The house manager at Epstein's ranch who initially received a cut of the witness's payments. The witness became friends with him, and he was later circumvented as Maxwell began calling the witness directly.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: Present for the FBI interview of the witness. Represents the prosecuting authority.

persons.name: Detective
persons.context: Present for the FBI interview of the witness.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Present for and presumably conducting the FBI interview of the witness.

connections.description: Witness thought Maxwell was Epstein's girlfriend and described her as the 'lady of the house.' They were at the ranch together for weeks at a time.
Maxwell, as the manager, began calling the witness directly, bypassing the house manager Omer who initially took a cut of payments.
Omer was the house manager at Epstein's ranch.
The witness massaged Epstein approximately 15 times and stated the massages turned sexual. She was paid by check from his corporation.
Maxwell managed the witness's work at the ranch, gave her a non-disclosure agreement, and instructed her on the type of new masseuses to bring.

events.title: Witness Graduates Massage School
events.description: The witness graduated from massage school.

events.title: Witness Begins Working at Epstein Ranch
events.description: The witness began providing massage services at Jeffrey Epstein's New Mexico ranch as a professional massage therapist.

events.title: Presented with Non-Disclosure Agreement
events.description: Approximately two years after starting work at the ranch, the witness was given a non-disclosure agreement by Ghislaine Maxwell. She did not sign it due to the legal jargon.

events.title: Vanity Fair Article Published
events.description: The witness recalled reading a Vanity Fair article about Jeffrey Epstein in 2003, which made her realize the significance of her client. She had stopped going to the ranch prior to its publication.

events.title: FBI Interview of Witness
events.description: The witness was interviewed by the FBI in New York, NY, regarding her experiences at Jeffrey Epstein's ranch.

keyFacts: A massage therapist worked at Jeffrey Epstein's New Mexico ranch from approximately 2000-2003, providing massages that turned sexual with Epstein.
Ghislaine Maxwell acted as the manager of the ranch, gave the witness a non-disclosure agreement, and made specific demands that new masseuses be 'good looking, pretty, young, no hairy pits.'
The witness described the layout of Epstein's ranch in detail, including a basement area with a massage room, gym, pool, and pictures of women with exposed breasts in a bathroom.
Payments for massages were made by check from Epstein's corporation, initially routed through house manager Omer before Maxwell took over direct contact.
The witness recalled seeing a soap opera star (known to law enforcement) at the ranch on more than one occasion around 2001/2002.
